title: An editor rejected my manuscript claiming it is similar to a not-yet-published manuscript (that I haven’t seen). How should I proceed? - Quora

response.answer_text: Don’t worry. This just means that publisher has something with a similar premise. For example, if you wrote a pirate story and they’re publishing a pirate story soon, they wouldn’t want to publish two similar books that would be competing with each other for sales. The editor’s response doesn’t mean that their book is so similar to yours that you should be concerned. Just try other publishers. Most of them will have different sorts of books that they are promoting. Good luck!

I’d be a bit excited. It means your book is in line with the current publishing trends but they have one too similar already being worked on. Publishing is a slow business and it takes roughly two years from a contract being signed to actually holding your finished book. I’d start submitting your story like crazy to other editors or agents and see what happens! All the Best!
Accept the rejection and move on. Happens often.
